commit_list.message: [CocoaPods/CocoaPods#1249] Separate header paths for different targets in .xcconfig files.

Allow customizing the naming convention for log files to use timestamps.

We find UUIDs to quite awkward in the field because the files cannot be
sorted in chronological order by filename. This patch adds an optional
convention to the DDLogFileManagerDefault class which uses timestamps
instead. The existing UUID-based naming convention is retained as the
default convention for backwards compatibility.

Timestamps are formatted as RFC 3339 dates in the UTC time zone.

Cache shortened URLs for a year
Fixed pattern url shortening for larger patterns
Switched to using jQuery BBQ, made updates less like a sledgehammer, and updated example pattern to new URL
Updated footer with beg for design help.
Added the example pattern, tweaked styling a bit
Make instruction detection a bit more robust
Increased freshness duration of the root page to 1 day
Optimized cache controls and ordering of external resources
Another bug fix for leading or following whitespace

Added explicit requires for haml and sass
Added task for circular vs. flat knitting
Moved some bugs to the backlog

Allow customizing the naming convention for log files to use timestamps.

We find UUIDs to quite awkward in the field because the files cannot be
sorted in chronological order by filename. This patch adds an optional
convention to the DDLogFileManagerDefault class which uses timestamps
instead. The existing UUID-based naming convention is retained as the
default convention for backwards compatibility.

Timestamps are formatted as RFC 3339 dates in the UTC time zone.
commit_list.repo_description: A fast & simple, yet powerful & flexible logging framework for Mac and iOS

commit_list.message:
In the README, explicitly set the port when starting foreman.

Otherwise it picks its own port.

Allow foreman to pick what port the server should run on

This means you can use `foreman start -p 3000` to start on port 3000.

Implement /stop/:code}/routes call

This involved moving the Trip data into the SQLite database in order to make it efficient enough for busy stops like Hurdman station.

This should also make the /trips/by_code/:code faster.

Merge branch 'master' of github.com:michaelmelanson/OCTranspo-data-access

Conflicts:
	Gemfile.lock
	application.rb
Add a README file with instructions for setting up the service & updating the data
Fix up the Gemfile a bit so we get the data processor's dependencies too

Prevent Ruby from caching the output of STDOUT

This lets foreman see the data immediately, so we get proper logs.

Fix "nearest stops" call

I was being too clever for my own good, trying to optimize the call by using the index instead of copying the stop data.

Made the /trips/by_stop call a bit nicer.

It now accepts a stop *code* rather than a stop ID. It also returns stop times as well as which routes serve a stop.
Updated Gemfile.lock & Procfile with changes needed for deployment
Added /stops?startswith=XYZ call which finds all stop codes that start with XYZ

Add /trips/by_stop/:id call, which fetches a list of routes that service a stop

Unfortunately this involves adding a 160MB SQLite database containing the stop times data...
Ready the application for deploying to Heroku
Added /stop/:code for getting stop data by code
